column4: I want to upgrade my kernel is this the easiest way? http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/
it fails on inserting my nvidia and vbox modules
vbox performance on guest is terrible I improved it with a build but read that upgrade fixes
what are the drm and drm-next?
is there another safe place to look for recent kernels?
a later kernel why?  it's useually best to stay with kernels from the Ubuntu repo
there is probably a ppa for a later kernel, but why do you want one?
performance in vbox is horid in the karmic kernels
that's probably more to do with your graphics card and RAM
no its a known bug that kernel upgrade fixes
ok well look for a ppa for a later kernel then
there is probably something on launchpad
uhmm   Ubuntu 9.10  kernel ppa  on Google or something like that, will bring one up I guess
launchpad is the trusted source for ppa's
found a ppa by using the key words I suggested or something similar?
